required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Mammography Reader Study to Assess Breast Cancer Detection in FFDM Plus DBT Versus FFDM Alone
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Reader Multi-Case Controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Comparative Accuracy of the Fujifilm Full Field Digital Mammography (FFDM) Plus Digital Breast Tomosynthesis (DBT) Versus FFDM Alone in the Detection of Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot is to provide credible performance estimate information in order to conduct subsequent reader studies.

detailed_description.textblock:
This pilot reader study was to determine the following:
1. the radiologist's performance metrics for the two reading modalities, i.e., "FFDM read on the Aspire Bellus workstation" and "FFDM read in conjunction with DBT read on the Aspire Bellus workstation",;
2. the magnitude and direction of differences between performance metrics for the two modalities; and
3. variance components and correlations that would influence samples sizes and case mix for the subsequent pivotal reader study comparing performance metrics between the two modalities.

primary_outcome.measure: Compare Per Subject Area Under Curve (AUC): FFDM Only vs DBT Plus FFDM
primary_outcome.description: Breast AUC performance metrics to determine if FFDM plus DBT improved cancer detection rate, requiring correct lesion localization. Statistician to estimate AUCs for each reader in each review condition (FFDM read in conjunction with FFDM plus DBT read) based on their Probability of Malignancy (POM) scores. POM scores will require correct lesion localization, such that in a case with cancer if the reader recorded one or more findings in the case but none of them are determined by the truther to match the location(s) of any proven malignancies, a POM score of 0 will be assigned to the case. Statistician to provide graphical representations of each reader's ROC curve for each review condition. For each reader the difference between the AUC for the FFDM read in conjunction with the FFDM plus DBT will be presented. Statistician to perform MRMC comparison of AUC's between FFDM read in conjunction with FFDM plus DBT using the MRMC method of Dorfman, Berbaum & Metz (1992).

arm_group.description: Breast Images with FFDM and DBT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female subjects participating in FMSU004A protocol with known clinical status
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with unknown clinical status not participating in FMSU004A protocol.

facility.name: University of North Carolina - at Chapel Hill
University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The 100 breast screening and diagnostic cases selected for this study, were obtained from the FMSU2013-004A acquisition study. The statistician randomly selected cases to provide a distribution of density, finding types, etc.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Each radiologist read all 100 cases as FFDM only and FFDM+DBT(100 cases multiplied by 2 modalities = 200 reads) with a 4 week washout period between the 2 sessions.

group.title: FFDM Plus DBT, Then FFDM Only
group.description: Readers to read half of the FFDM plus DBT images followed by half of the FFDM only images at each of the 2 sessions. There was a 4 week memory washout period between the 2 sessions.

group.title: FFDM Only, Then FFDM Plus DBT
group.description: Readers to read half of the FFDM only images followed by half of the FFDM plus DBT images at each of the 2 sessions. There was a 4 week memory washout period between the 2 sessions.

baseline.population: There were 100 study participants (resulting in 200 images) in total who had their images reviewed by 6 radiologist readers. Images were acquired under acquisition study FMSU2013-004A.

group.title: All 100 Cases/Study Participants
group.description: Each case contributed 2 sets of images: FFDM only as well as DBT plus FFDM. Therefore there were 200 reads acquired from the 100 cases/participants.

outcome.title: Compare Per Subject Area Under Curve (AUC): FFDM Only vs DBT Plus FFDM
outcome.description: Breast AUC performance metrics to determine if FFDM plus DBT improved cancer detection rate, requiring correct lesion localization. Statistician to estimate AUCs for each reader in each review condition (FFDM read in conjunction with FFDM plus DBT read) based on their Probability of Malignancy (POM) scores. POM scores will require correct lesion localization, such that in a case with cancer if the reader recorded one or more findings in the case but none of them are determined by the truther to match the location(s) of any proven malignancies, a POM score of 0 will be assigned to the case. Statistician to provide graphical representations of each reader's ROC curve for each review condition. For each reader the difference between the AUC for the FFDM read in conjunction with the FFDM plus DBT will be presented. Statistician to perform MRMC comparison of AUC's between FFDM read in conjunction with FFDM plus DBT using the MRMC method of Dorfman, Berbaum & Metz (1992).
outcome.population: The study employed a fully factorial, counterbalanced crossover design in which all readers reviewed images from all cases in two visits separated by a memory washout period of approximately 4 weeks. Each reader read half FFDM cases and half FFDM + DBT cases during each of 2 visits.

group.title: FFDM Plus DBT
group.description: Breast Images with FFDM and DBT FFDM Plus DBT: Fujifilm Aspire Cristalle System

group.title: FFDM
group.description: Breast Images with FFDM alone FFDM: Fujifilm Aspire Cristalle System

measure.title: Compare Per Subject Area Under Curve (AUC): FFDM Only vs DBT Plus FFDM
measure.description: Breast AUC performance metrics to determine if FFDM plus DBT improved cancer detection rate, requiring correct lesion localization. Statistician to estimate AUCs for each reader in each review condition (FFDM read in conjunction with FFDM plus DBT read) based on their Probability of Malignancy (POM) scores. POM scores will require correct lesion localization, such that in a case with cancer if the reader recorded one or more findings in the case but none of them are determined by the truther to match the location(s) of any proven malignancies, a POM score of 0 will be assigned to the case. Statistician to provide graphical representations of each reader's ROC curve for each review condition. Statistician to perform MRMC comparison of AUC's between FFDM read in conjunction with FFDM plus DBT using the MRMC method of Dorfman, Berbaum & Metz (1992).
measure.population: The study employed a fully factorial, counterbalanced crossover design in which all readers reviewed images from all cases in two visits separated by a memory washout period of approximately 4 weeks. Each reader read half FFDM cases and half FFDM + DBT cases during each of 2 visits.

reported_events.desc: There were no AE's expected for this study, as it was a radiologist reader study utilizing retrospective imaging. No study subjects were on-site for this retrospective review. No Adverse Events to report.

group.title: FFDM Plus DBT
group.description: Breast Images with FFDM and DBT FFDM Plus DBT: Fujifilm Aspire Cristalle System

group.title: FFDM
group.description: Breast Images with FFDM alone FFDM: Fujifilm Aspire Cristalle System

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
